Configuration class for OpenAPI/Swagger documentation of the OpenFrame External API, defining API metadata, authentication schemes, and endpoint grouping.

## Key Components

- **`openAPI()`** - Main OpenAPI configuration bean that defines API metadata, authentication, and documentation
- **`externalApiGroup()`** - Groups specific API endpoints for external consumption while excluding internal paths
- **API Key Authentication** - Configures X-API-Key header-based authentication scheme
- **Rate Limiting Documentation** - Embedded documentation for API rate limits and usage guidelines

## Usage Example

```java
// This configuration automatically applies to all Spring Boot controllers
// and generates Swagger UI documentation available at /swagger-ui.html

@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/v1")
public class ExternalController {
    
    @Operation(summary = "Get user data", security = @SecurityRequirement(name = "ApiKeyAuth"))
    @GetMapping("/users/{id}")
    public ResponseEntity<User> getUser(
        @RequestHeader("X-API-Key") String apiKey,
        @PathVariable String id) {
        // Implementation uses the configured API key authentication
        return ResponseEntity.ok(userService.findById(id));
    }
}

// Access documentation at:
// - Swagger UI: http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui.html
// - OpenAPI JSON: http://localhost:8080/v3/api-docs
// - Grouped docs: http://localhost:8080/v3/api-docs/external-api
```

The configuration includes comprehensive API documentation with authentication requirements, rate limiting details, and error handling guidelines embedded directly in the OpenAPI specification.
